DataElement.preferredName: Within Hematopoietic Stem Cell Graft Infusion Procedure Other Additive Administered Therapies Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The free-text field to describe other additives that were included in the infused hematopoietic cell product.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Within Hematopoietic Stem Cell Graft Infusion Procedure Other Additive Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: On the inside; contained in._Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)_Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body._A method of putting fluids, including drugs, into the bloodstream. Also called intravenous infusion._Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._A substance that is added to a system or compound to improve its characteristics._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ObjectClass.preferredName: Within Hematopoietic Stem Cell Graft Infusion Procedure Other Additive
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: On the inside; contained in.:Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.):Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body.:A method of putting fluids, including drugs, into the bloodstream. Also called intravenous infusion.:Not otherwise specified.:A substance that is added to a system or compound to improve its characteristics.

Concepts.definition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)
Tissue or organ transplanted from a donor to a recipient.
Any form of treatment that is introduced into the body via a blood vessel, a muscle, or the spinal cord.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
A substance that is added to a system or compound to improve its characteristics.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
